summary.para: Called when a key down event occurs.

param.name: pic
param.para: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

param.name: pfEaten
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event was handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event was handled. If this value is FALSE, the key event was not handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Called when a key up event occurs.

param.name: pic
param.para: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

param.name: pfEaten
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event was handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event was handled. If this value receives FALSE, the key event was not handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Called when a preserved key event occurs.

param.name: pic
param.para: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Contains the command GUID of the preserved key.

param.name: pfEaten
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL value that, on exit, indicates if the preserved key event was handled. If this value receives TRUE, the preserved key event was handled. If this value receives FALSE, the preserved key event was not handled.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Called when a TSF text service receives or loses the keyboard focus.

param.name: fForeground
param.para: If TRUE, the test service receives the focus. Otherwise the text service loses the focus.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Called to determine if a text service will handle a key down event.

param.name: pic
param.para: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

param.name: pfEaten
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event would be handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event would be handled. If this value is FALSE, the key event would not be handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Called to determine if a text service will handle a key up event.

param.name: pic
param.para: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

param.name: pfEaten
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event would be handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event would be handled. If this value receives FALSE, the key event would not be handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: The ITfKeyEventSink interface is implemented by a text service to receive keyboard and focus event notifications. To install this event sink, call .
